abstract: Remittances to countries like Mexico, Pakistan and Vietnam are keeping pace with 2019's record levels or in some cases rising, despite spring forecasts of a 20% decline.
alt: A graph shows the nearly exponential increase in remittances since 1980. It reads: Cash transfers soar. The amount of cash migrants from low- and middle-income countries sent home to their friends and family reached a record $554 billion in 2019.
